item.title: How to pass a JSON object to a Spring Boot request
item.description: Photo credit Just before the holidays, I was working on writing some more lesson content for a Spring Data Neo4j course. To save an entity to the database, I needed to pass a JSON object containing the entityâ€™s properties to a Spring Boot controller method. Each time I wanted to test the code, I had to manually create the JSON object and pass it to the controller method on the command line.
